attributes.action: Protect Final Salary Pension Schemes for Private Sector pensions by declining the
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: proposal from a government-commissioned report to remove vital protection against inflation. If implemented it would mean that companies would not need to increase the annual pension income by the addition of the Retail Prices Index currently capped at 2.5pc (reduced by the Government in 2005 from 5pc) resulting in the pension income reducing over the forthcoming years. In addition this proposal has only been suggested for private pensions already targeted in many other ways and will not affect the public sector pensions (including those of MPs).

reasons: Wording that needs to be amended, or is impossible to understand
